instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.PP5V_S0_ALSCAM_F: What is PP5V_S0_ALSCAM_F? PP5V_S0_ALSCAM is a power rail for the webcam and the ambient light sensor..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> camera not working
threads.message:
hello i have here <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> camera not working 
action taken: change tophalf 2 times same problem. i test again another tophalf came from working unit still the same.
i test the original  tophalf from another board camera is working so i can confirm this is from motherboard problem so,
i did  some visual check on motherboard seems ok didnt see any corroded parts and
 i did also some diode to ground regarding camera rails (j8500) it seams good didnt see any short. 
what do i need to check. thanks in advace!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> camera not working
threads.message:
Direct flaslight to the camera and check if keyboard backlight reacts.
Or tap the webcam with your hand.
This way you can confirm if Ambient Light Sensor is working...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> camera not working
threads.message:
Any history fault available?
Is the webcam recognized in system report?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> camera not working
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 78536, member: 682"]
Any history fault
[/QUOTE]

i recieved this macbook with cracked screen only  so i just changed only the lcd after 1 day the lcd suddenly no display (blue screen)
then instead of changing again the lcd, i decided to change the lcd assembly (tophalf) customer complaining camera is not working i stated also to my original post changed tophalf many times.
also my customer claiming before i changed the lcd the camera was working.
system report: cant recognize the camera

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> camera not working
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> camera not working
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> camera not working
threads.message:
If the fault was located on MLB for sure, then check for knocked off components, or broken traces.
Check voltage on the coils near <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> (page 36).

Please, please, stop to quote previous post: looks really ugly.
Do NOT click Reply button, write directly into bottom Reply box...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> camera not working
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> camera not working
threads.message:
Two readings for a coil, any reason?
ALWAYS check the voltage on the output pin of the coil, where is placed the filter cap.
Don't waste time in the future.

If the webcam was working before for sure, then something happened when replaced the screen.
I can only think about mechanical damage; broken traces, or components.
Check all the coils placed on camera lines (page 37) and resistors (page 66).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> camera not working
threads.message:
hello i would like to continue this issue, anyways i still not solve this issue. 

now i have the same this issue with another <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> with the same board number (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a)
here is the scenario for the 2nd time:
i recieved this macbook with the cracked lcd only, 1st i changed the top half evrything is ok i tested the camera it is working, i just notice 
that the camera got dust it is so obvious, so i need to change another tophalf. after i changed another tophalf after i opened the camera it has a msg the camera is not connected, so i tried changed 1more still the same, so i put back the 1st i install (have the camera dust) still camera not detected, almost the same with my original post. 

can anybody have the same issue or any advices to help me. 

i tried run diagostics im having error code: NDC001 there may be an issue with the camera.

i tried also clean me using @informaticos another post [URL]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-no-brain-after-big-sur-update.61525/[/URL]
still the same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> camera not working
threads.message:
I suppose knocked off components, broken traces, or connectors issue.
Can't be electronic problem, if no power/battery was connected in the screen swap process.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> camera not working
threads.message:
no knocked off components
battery was removed before and after the tophalf replacement. 
i do believe i didnt damage any components when changing the screen. 
and i know im not the only 1 having this issue. 
im thinking maybe from the part number/version of the screen
having issue. or maybe i didnt remove the battery connector when i remove the lcd connector for the
2ndtime i change the screen (also maybe didnt shutdown the macbook and then the camera app still on.
 but im sure when i put the screen battery was disconnected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> camera not working
threads.message:
update i found the knocked off component. 
L4080 is cracked (<SIGNAL>MIPI_CLK</SIGNAL>)
but after i replaced the L4080 the camera still not working. 

any nextstep [USER=682]@2informaticos[/USER] ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> camera not working
threads.message:
There are many small simple/dual coils; check continuity for all of them.
Also be sure no scratched traces, camera related.
